-Yvv2P7PgnKt__gnLL-Mww.text: Delicious coffee!! The cappuccino was just spot on!  This was a perfect little getaway spot from the rain that started and didn't seem to want to stop.  The hostesses and wait staff were very nice  and cheerful even though the place was packed and people kept trying to come.  But that coffee.. Yum!

m4rysN8E1PxZuuObZVX3yA.text: Cute place for lunch or coffee/ tea. I ordered a premise beet and goat sandwich with tortilla chips and side salad for less than 7 pounds. The bread was thick and tasty. Filling sandwich. Cozy room in the back of this small restaurant with outdoor seating also.

photos.caption: Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Outside seating
Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

fkUh5fTfVmAwoZe6sjqjOQ.text: Cozy little spot tucked away in beautiful Edinburgh...not many seats and tables but if you can get one, I highly recommend an afternoon coffee and pastry....

USSWOHBnwjg-eFVqht3xHg.text: I came today after finding Elephant House to be too crowded to study. We were drawn in by the brownies in the window, which they had samples for inside! They were so moist and tasty. The music not too loud or distracting, and inside smells so lovely, like baked goods and chocolate. They take card and have outlets so you can plug your devices in. The tea came in a cute little pot with milk, and the cappuccinos did not come with milk art- not an issue though. The toilet is kind of gross though, be warned.

photos.caption: Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

GTh9yzwDl57DhEGloTociA.text: Stopped here for breakfast coffee and pastries. Small, cute coffee shop right in the heart of the tourist zone (count us in on that, we were visiting the Fringe). We asked for the breakfast pancakes that were on the blackboard but were told it would take a while accompanied by a pained look as if we were asking for something outlandish so not wanting to put them out, we settled instead for a croissant with the coffee but had to wait about 10 minutes before they brought over with the coffee. No napkin. I noticed the people on the table opposite had to get their own cutlery.   Coffee was good. Afterwards we waited a few further minutes to pay as they took the order first from someone else who stepped in front of us at the counter so didn't return the next day.

kNKc0fcelpZlAJLcAqoLMA.text: Nice selection of hot coffees and teas, as well as sandwiches and a soup of the day. They even sell a selection of ice creams... which is odd in Edinburgh.   I had the coronation chicken sandwich and a leek and potato soup (served in a large bowl) for 5.   Tasty, affordable, quick, and right off the busy Royal Mile. It has only been here for two months, but I look forward to more. Definitely will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soup of the day: Leek and Potato
Photo of Zebra Coffee Co - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Coronado Chicken Sandwich

4xGZEVE3JtOFWAd9kqdB4w.text: This is my kind of coffee shop.  Excellent coffee in all the expected configurations, and tasty pastries and sweets.  More importantly (at least in my assessment of coffee shops) is the cozy atmosphere, excellent wi-fi, accessible outlets, and laid back atmosphere.  I don't get to Edinburgh as often as I'd like, but I'm coming here when I come back.

mh7nYfA5OwkzrsTe02Y7cg.text: Great seating in the back of the place!  Cute bookshelf wallpaper :)  Just noticed a few days ago that they're open until around 10pm during the festival, so I'll be going back soon.  Plus they have free wifi :)  The only downside is that it's a pretty small place - maybe seats around 10-15 people max.  But if you're looking to grab something and go, then it's in a great location just off the royal mile.

rjjOjawr2jd_7-7uflTvZg.text: Very cute little coffee shop. We went around eleven on a Tuesday before the castle and it was quiet. The coffee is good. I had a latte. But I really want to try the amazing looking scones next time!

jjJ0p5gzaIR-OlOXlIj8_g.text: It was a bit of a mixed bag from Zebra, on my recent visit.   They've taken the smart decision to source their soups and salads from Union of Genius, so they can be relied upon to be excellent, at all times. Sadly, their sandwiches weren't up to much, and Lavazza isn't a coffee favourite, with me, so there's definitely room for improvement.  So overall, we said: "I thought Zebra was rather smart, and has made a very wise choice in their soup stockist. They have some work to do to improve the sandwiches, though, but there's every reason to think that can be achieved. I look forward to popping in again, soon, to check on progress."
